intro: Villarsia communis, commonly known as the common villarsia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a velvety texture. Villarsia communis is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
